job_title: Admissions Counselor in Mount Vernon, GA
pros:
Great people to work with.
Hours and time off is great.
cons: Not a lot of opportunity for growth in field.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mount Vernon, GA
pros: The people you work with are very supportive and fun to be around. Vacation time and flex time are awesome, and the insurance is great. It's a great place to start building or to beef up your resume. Most teams are motivated and quick to get things done the right way. The campus is beautiful and you can't beat $3.50 meals in the cafeteria and half days on Fridays.
cons: It is a private Christian college, which would make you think that pay is high, but it is not. You do have to conform to a certain southern baptist bubble to work here. The ambitions for the college are high, but staffing is low because of pay and high turnover. Room for growth is very limited unless you are with the college for 5+ years. Even if you are an expert in your field, the executive team will trash your advice to instead to it their own way, which is usually outdated. Most of the powerful positions are held by men while women are in jobs that actually keep the college running.

job_title: Assistant Coach in Mount Vernon, GA
pros: Everyone is kind and its a fun job at times.
cons: Food is nasty, super tiny town, and pay is bad. Everyone has to work 2+ positions to make ends meet for families.

review_title: I've had a good experience, I like the Christian environment
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Mount Vernon, GA
pros: convenient location to town, other employees are very friendly & helpful to new students, Christian atmosphere, great dining, good hours
cons: offices are short staffed due to cut backs and layoffs. We have to use work study students to catch up on duties.

review_title: I love working in a Christian environment.
pros: The Christian atmosphere at Brewton-Parker College is great. The faculty and staff are very concerned about the students' education and future.
cons: Some of the offices are short staffed due to layoffs and the status of the economy in the United States.

pros:
